Corey_Smith_(musician):
{{short description|American singer-songwriter}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Corey Smith | image = Corey Smith 2013.jpg | alt = | caption = Smith performing at the House of Blues [[Sunset Strip]] in [[Hollywood, California|Hollywood]] in 2013 | image_size = | background = solo_singer | alias = | birth_date = | birth_place = [[Jefferson, Georgia]], United States | origin = | genre = [[Country music|Country]], [[folk rock]] | occupation = Singer-songwriter, guitarist | instrument = | years_active = 2000–present | label = Undertone Records, [[Average Joes Entertainment]], [[Sugar Hill Records (bluegrass label)|Sugar Hill Records]] | associated_acts = | website = | notable_instruments = }} '''Corey Smith''' is an American singer-songwriter and guitarist. ==Background== Smith grew up in [[Jefferson, Georgia]], near [[Athens, Georgia|Athens]]. He attended the [[University of Georgia]] and majored in Social Studies education.[http://www.redandblack.com/2010/10/14/corey-smith-trades-chalk-for-microphone-singer’s-lyrics-take-on-new-form/] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20101023171533/http://www.redandblack.com/2010/10/14/corey-smith-trades-chalk-for-microphone-singer%E2%80%99s-lyrics-take-on-new-form/ |date=October 23, 2010 }} While in college, he wrote songs and performed locally. He took a job teaching at [[North Gwinnett High School]] in [[Suwanee, Georgia]] and taught geography, history, and guitar before deciding to pursue music full-time at the age of 28.{{cite web|title=Corey Smith, the $4 million self-made musician, on what matters most|url=http://www.dailyfinance.com/2009/07/14/corey-smith-the-4-million-self-made-musician-on-what-matters/|publisher=Daily Finance|accessdate=26 June 2012}}{{cite news|title=Corey Smith: Label the Singer a Success on His Own Terms|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2009/07/10/AR2009071000063.html|accessdate=26 June 2012|newspaper=The Washington Post|date=12 July 2009}} ==Albums== From his first album ''Undertones'' in 2003, Smith self-produced nine albums through independent labels. In 2015 he released his tenth album, ''While the Getting' Is Good'', produced by [[Keith Stegall]] on [[Sugar Hill Records (bluegrass label)|Sugar Hill Records]]{{Cite web|url=https://rounder.com/sugar-hill-records/|title=Sugar Hill Records|website=rounder.com|accessdate=2020-03-15}}{{cite web|title=CMT Artists: About Corey Smith|url=http://www.cmt.com/artists/corey-smith/biography/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150628234118/http://www.cmt.com/artists/corey-smith/biography/|url-status=dead|archive-date=June 28, 2015|website=[[CMT (American TV channel)|CMT]]|publisher=Viacom|access-date=April 8, 2017}} ==Discography== ===Studio albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! rowspan="2" style="width:16em;"| Title ! rowspan="2" style="width:20em;"| Details ! colspan="6"| Peak chart positions |- style="font-size:smaller;" ! width="40"| [[Top Country Albums|US Country]]
